phrases.transcription: wey ʔakuntkšˊ kunˊ hus hiʔinkiˊ ʔišinˊ.
phrases.translation: The bear was at home.

phrases.transcription: wetkˊ pu·pˊ ʔap ʔehyiˊ we ʔakin kinˊ nampapi gihtkˊ, ʔun kun guščuyiˊ tupčukˊ, we pu·p hišˊ hi te·tiʔi.
phrases.translation: Then the rabbit came and wanted to live with the bear.

phrases.transcription: kunuguˊ we pu·pˊ panš naʔankˊ hi ču·gšˊ we kičkˊ he·š ʔučpaˊ ʔuča·šnakšˊ.
phrases.translation: The rabbit went to some people and (found) the women were making prepared-meal.

phrases.transcription: we pu·p hišˊ na·kšbu hečmaʔiˊ.
phrases.translation: The rabbit took care of the children for them.

phrases.transcription: wetkšˊ he·š ʔučpaˊ hi ʔa·naʔaˊ.
phrases.translation: Then they gave him some prepared-meal.

phrases.transcription: wetkˊ kas ču·gˊ we ʔakun čunˊ we he·š ʔučpašˊ kas mačiʔiˊ.
phrases.translation: Returning, he brought the prepared-meal back for the bear.

phrases.transcription: wetkšˊ we ʔakuntkšˊ we he·š ʔučpa guštiʔiˊ.
phrases.translation: The bear ate that prepared-meal.

phrases.transcription: ʔakun hišˊ, ʔašt ʔuči·gˊ ha· neˊ tuptiˊ.
phrases.translation: The bear (said), “How did you find this?”

phrases.transcription: wetkšˊ we pu·p hišˊ natmaʔiˊ, ʔiškˊ na·kšbuˊ hunks kutˊ nehmikiˊ ʔiš wašinkˊ.
phrases.translation: The rabbit told him, “I beat the heads of children with my hand.

phrases.transcription: weyǯi·gšˊ hi ketiščukiˊ we he·š ʔučpašˊ ʔap ʔa·kinaʔaˊ.
phrases.translation: Therefore, in order that I betake myself off, they gave me that prepared-meal.”

phrases.transcription: wetkˊ ʔakun hišˊ hi te·tiʔiˊ, nokkiˋ ʔiš ču·čukˊ.
phrases.translation: Then the bear said, “Let me go.

phrases.transcription: ʔiš wašišˊ him ʔeypi hi waytmˊ ʔatkapaˊ.
phrases.translation: My hand is bigger than yours.”

phrases.transcription: wetkšˊ we panš pinikank kičantkankˊ we ʔam ni kihcpuynankšˊ we ʔakun getkˊ ni tiškinnaˊ.
phrases.translation: Then the old Indian women beat the bear with their (grain) beaters and knocked him down.

phrases.transcription: wetkšˊ ʔapš kayinkišˊ kap ti·guni·gˊ, hus hiʔinkˊ kas ču·gˊ, ʔiškaˊ pu·pkˊ hi te·tiʔiˊ, ʔamin hiš ganˊ načpičuyiˊ.
phrases.translation: When he returned to consciousness, he was angry and went home saying to the rabbit, “Nothing will save you.

phrases.transcription: himkˊ kap gušgaˊ.
phrases.translation: I mean to eat you up.”

phrases.transcription: we ʔakuntkšˊ kas ʔehinkišˊ pu·pkˊ hananki neˊ či· ganˊ.
phrases.translation: When the bear got back, the rabbit was not in the house at al.

phrases.transcription: wetkšˊ we ʔakunˊ ʔanǯit nakˊ hus hanankiˊ ʔapš ʔišmiˊ, tewe·š we pu·pˊ tupti ganˊ.
phrases.translation: Then the bear looked everywhere in the house, but could not find the rabbit.

phrases.transcription: wetkš ʔakuntkšˊ pu·pˊ hi kowiˊ, ʔanǯupˊ čuyiˊ.
phrases.translation: Then the bear called the rabbit, “Where did you go?”

phrases.transcription: wetkšˊ we ʔakunˊ ču·gšˊ, nadiʔiˊ tu·kun kiˊ.
phrases.translation: Then the bear went and lay down on a sack.

phrases.transcription: wetkšˊ hus tu·kun gaptkˊ si·c hišˊ wa·gipi ʔuči·gšˊ nadiʔiˊ.
phrases.translation: He took his sack, made a pillow (by filling it) with green (Spanish) moss, and lay down.

phrases.transcription: wetkšˊ pu·pkˊ ʔap huhčwiʔiˊ makš tu·kun kinˊ.
phrases.translation: Then the rabbit came in with a bag of fish.

phrases.transcription: ʔiškaˊ we ʔakun hišˊ we pu·pˊ ni wopmiʔiˊ, ha ǯimašˊ ʔam ʔap mači·gšiˊ.
phrases.translation: The bear asked the rabbit, “What have you brought back tonight?”

phrases.transcription: makš tu·kun kap ho·pnˊ ʔap mačikiˊ.
phrases.translation: “I brought a sack full of fish.”

phrases.transcription: wetkˊ ʔakun hišˊ hi te·tiʔiˊ, ʔiškˊ ču·čukišˊ, ʔiš tu·kuntkˊ him ʔeypi hi waytmˊ ʔatiˊ.
phrases.translation: Then the bear said, “If I go, my sack will be bigger than yours.

phrases.transcription: Him hi waytmˊ ʔowaˊ gapčukiˊ, ʔišˊ ču·čukišˊ.
phrases.translation: I’ll catch more than you if I go.”

phrases.transcription: wetkˊ čuyiʔiˊ, tewe·šˊ ku· hupˊ hi ʔehinkiˊ šipšǯapenkˊ gahtkˊ, ʔakunˊ kap šeygučinaʔaˊ.
phrases.translation: Then he went, but when he got to the water a loggerhead turtle bit and wounded the bear.

phrases.transcription: wetkˊ ʔapš memtemi·gˊ we šipšǯapešˊ hi hoktpiˊ.
phrases.translation: By jumping about, he made the loggerhead let go.

phrases.transcription: wetkšˊ ʔapš čuyiˊ hanankˊ.
phrases.translation: Then he came back to the house.

phrases.transcription: wetkˊ ʔiškaˊ pu·pˊ hi te·tiʔiˊ, ʔamin hiš ganˊ himkˊ načpičuyiˊ.
phrases.translation: He said to the rabbit, “Nothing will save you now.

phrases.transcription: himˊ kap guščukingˊ.
phrases.translation: I must eat you up.”

phrases.transcription: we ʔakuntkšˊ hus hiʔinkˊ kas ʔehišˊ, we pu·pkˊ hahankiˊ ʔišči· ganˊ.
phrases.translation: When the bear got to his house, the rabbit was not in the house.

phrases.transcription: kunuguˊ hushani huynakˊ ʔapš ʔišiʔiˊ.
phrases.translation: He searched all over his house.

phrases.transcription: tep ši· kiˊ ʔampup ʔo·nakˊ ʔišiʔiˊ.
phrases.translation: He looked in the fire dust (ashes) and everywhere.

phrases.transcription: we tep ši· kiˊ we pu·pkˊ tuskš penˊ.
phrases.translation: The rabbit lay hidden in those ashes.

phrases.transcription: weytintkaˊ we ʔakuntkšˊ we pu·pˊ tupti gayiˊ.
phrases.translation: Nevertheless the bear did not find the rabbit.

phrases.transcription: wetkšˊ ču·gšˊ, hus wa·gipankiˊ hi nadiʔiˊ.
phrases.translation: Then he went and lay down on his pillow.

phrases.transcription: wetkˊ hi te·tiʔiˊ, pu·p hiš neˊ hi hoktkiˊ.
phrases.translation: He said, “Rabbit has left me.

phrases.transcription: ʔiš gišˊ hihčukingˊ da·tkˊ hesigentkˊ.
phrases.translation: I have to be alone again now.”

phrases.transcription: wetkšˊ kunuguˊ pu·pkšˊ ʔap huhčwiʔiˊ tu·kunˊ nakšǯi kinˊ kap ho·pnˊ.
phrases.translation: Then the rabbit came in with a bag full of blackberries.

phrases.transcription: wetkšˊ ʔakun hišˊ ni wopmiʔiˊ, ʔam ʔap mačiˊ ha ǯimašˊ.
phrases.translation: Bear asked, “What did you bring me tonight?”

phrases.transcription: nakšǯiˊ ʔap mačikiˊ ni guščuyiˊ.
phrases.translation: “I brought home blackberries for you to eat.”

phrases.transcription: we pu·p hišˊ wey te·tiʔiˊ.
phrases.translation: The rabbit said that.

phrases.transcription: ʔašt ʔuči·gšˊ teˋ nakšǯi ʔoši sa·tˊ ʔap mačiʔiˊ.
phrases.translation: “What did you do to bring so many blackberries?”

phrases.transcription: ʔiškˊ tekt kiˊ ʔapš nuhčmi·gˊ, ʔiš tu·kunˊ kap ho·ppikiˊ.
phrases.translation: “I ran about in the briars and filled my sack.”

phrases.transcription: ʔišˊ ču·čukišˊ, him hi waytmˊ nakšǯišˊ ʔap mačičukiˊ.
phrases.translation: “If I go I’ll bring more blackberries than you.”

phrases.transcription: wetkˊ kunuguˊ čuyiˊ.
phrases.translation: Then he went.

phrases.transcription: wetkˊ pu·p te·tˊ ʔučiʔiˊ.
phrases.translation: Then he did as the rabbit (had done).

phrases.transcription: we tekt segisˊ ʔapš nuhčmiʔiˊ, tewe·škˊ hus nehengišˊ ʔapš paktmiˊ.
phrases.translation: He ran about amidst the briars, but he scratched himself all up.

phrases.transcription: wetkˊ ʔapš ʔehyiˊ.
phrases.translation: Then he returned.

phrases.transcription: ʔuybinkˊ kap pi·hni·gšˊ, ʔapš ʔehyiˊ.
phrases.translation: Red with blood, he returned.

phrases.transcription: wetkšˊ pu·pkšˊ ʔam ʔučičuy neˊ ka·kwi gaygšˊ, hanankiˊ ʔapš nuhčmiˊ.
phrases.translation: Then the rabbit ran about in the house not knowing what to do.

phrases.transcription: wetkšˊ neyt tu·kun kiˊ hi šahdiʔiˊ.
phrases.translation: He scrambled into a tobacco bag.

phrases.transcription: ʔakuntkšˊ hesigenˊ we pu·p čunˊ ni ʔišiʔiˊ, tewe·šˊ we pu·pkˊ kas tuskˊ ʔišinˊ we neyt tu·kun kiˊ.
phrases.translation: Again the bear looked for the rabbit, but the rabbit was hidden in the tobacco bag.

phrases.transcription: wetkˊ ʔakun hišˊ hus wa·gipi gaptkˊ, hesigenˊ hi nadiʔiˊ.
phrases.translation: Then the bear took his pillow and again lay down.

phrases.transcription: wetkˊ ʔiškaˊ we ʔakunˊ te·tiʔiˊ, data ka·kwi·gš čikiˊ ʔiš gišˊ hikiˊ hesigenˊ.
phrases.translation: The bear said, “Now I am alone again.”

phrases.transcription: wetkšˊ pu·p hišˊ we ʔakuntkˊ ne·mpapi gihtkˊ hunˊ ni šiʔišinˊ.
phrases.translation: Then the rabbit, wishing to frighten that bear, spoke.

phrases.transcription: gopˊ gopˊ gopˊ gopˊ, te·tinˊ.
phrases.translation: “Gop, gop, gop, gop,” he kept saying.

phrases.transcription: wetkˊ we ʔakuntkšˊ kap ne·miʔiˊ.
phrases.translation: The bear took fright.

phrases.transcription: ʔam kap neškapi keystigiˊ hus wa·gipankiˊ wopiʔiˊ.
phrases.translation: He heard something very strange in his pillow.

phrases.transcription: wetkˊ hus wa·gipašˊ ʔapš ni heyšmi·gˊ, hus nukunkiˊ kap pehčtiʔiˊ.
phrases.translation: Then he gathered up his pillow and put it on his back.

phrases.transcription: wetkˊ, ha hanankišˊ ʔiškˊ hi· ka·hanˊ.
phrases.translation: Then (he said), “I cannot stay in your house.

phrases.transcription: hani hi hoktkˊ ču·čukingˊ.
phrases.translation: I must leave the house and go.”

phrases.transcription: wetkˊ šuš hupˊ hi čuyiʔiˊ.
phrases.translation: Then he went to the woods.

phrases.transcription: we pu·pkˊ tu·kun kiˊ hi šahyk hinˊ.
phrases.translation: The rabbit was in the bag.

phrases.transcription: ʔiškaˊ gopˊ gopˊ ʔuša·šinˊ ʔaštkanki ʔo·nakˊ.
phrases.translation: Every now and then, he went, “Gop, gop.”

phrases.transcription: wetkˊ šuš segupˊ weǯgiˊ hi čuyi·nkišˊ ǯu· keystigiˊ, gopˊ gopˊ gopˊ gopˊ, ʔuča·šinˊ.
phrases.translation: Then when he had gone far into the woods, he went, “Gop, gop, gop, gop, gop,” very rapidly.

phrases.transcription: wetkˊ we ʔakuntkˊ hus tu·kunˊ hi tiškintkˊ nuhčiʔiˊ.
phrases.translation: Then the bear threw down the bag and ran.

phrases.transcription: wetkˊ pu·pˊ šandiwi·gˊ, hesigenˊ, gopˊ gopˊ gopˊ, ʔučiʔiˊ we ʔakuntkšˊ ne·mpapi gihtkˊ.
phrases.translation: Then the rabbit came out and, wishing to frighten that bear again, went, “Gop, gop, gop.”

phrases.transcription: wetkˊ ya· hi waytmˊ hi nuhčiʔiˊ.
phrases.translation: He ran faster still.

phrases.transcription: weyǯi·gˊ we pu·pkˊ ʔakuntkˊ ni kamgetiʔiˊ.
phrases.translation: That is how the rabbit fooled the bear.

phrases.transcription: tewe·šˊ hišˊ gušti gayiʔiˊ.
phrases.translation: At any rate, the bear did not eat him.
